title: EVALUATION OF THE PRONUNCIATION OF TAJWEED RULES BASED ON DNN AS A STEP TOWARDS INTERACTIVE RECITATION LEARNING
author: Dim Shaiakhmetov (Ala-Too International University), Selcuk Cankurt (Vistula University), Gulnaz Gimaletdinova (Ala-Too International University), Kadyrmamat Momunov (Ala-Too International University), ...
relevance_why: The use of deep learning for automatic evaluation of pronunciation aligns with Haohe Liu's research interests in audio processing, particularly in developing effective frameworks for classification tasks in audio.
background: The study aims to evaluate the pronunciation of Tajweed rules in Quranic recitation by classifying recordings using deep learning.
contribution: This paper introduces a deep learning model to classify three Tajweed rules, achieving accuracy rates above 95% in evaluation.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily relied on traditional machine learning techniques and smaller datasets, limiting their applicability.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs the EfficientNet-B0 architecture with an attention mechanism to enhance classification performance using a larger, publicly available dataset.

key_innovation: Utilizes advanced deep learning techniques to assess specific rules of pronunciation in Quranic recitation, making it interactive and accessible.
real_world_impact: This approach enhances the learning experience for users of varying backgrounds, potentially transforming Quranic education with scalable solutions for remote learning.
limitations: Limited dataset size could constrain the generalizability of the model across different recitation styles.

new_terms.Tajweed: **Tajweed** refers to the set of rules governing the pronunciation during the reading of the Quran, making it critical for correct recitation.
new_terms.EfficientNet-B0: **EfficientNet-B0** is a convolutional neural network architecture designed to achieve higher efficiency in terms of both accuracy and computational cost.
